properties.address: Draper Hall, London, London SE1 6TL
properties.description: At Draper Together, our aim is to build a stronger, more connected community by providing activities and services that address social isolation, food insecurity, and youth development. Rooted in the heart of Southwark, we focus particularly on supporting vulnerable residents in and around Elephant and Castle. We run a wide range of activities that cater to the diverse needs of our community. Our weekly Kids' Club offers a safe, nurturing environment where young people can engage in creative learning and build friendships. We operate a twice-weekly food bank and a weekly food hub, providing essential support to families facing hardship. For older residents, we host regular social activities designed to combat loneliness and encourage community participation. In addition, we facilitate a weekly men's wellness group at Clapham Cube, combining boxing and mental health discussions to promote emotional resilience and personal growth. Draper Together is a registered charity, governed by a Board of Trustees who bring expertise in community development, education, health, and the arts. Our day-to-day operations are overseen by a small, dedicated team of staff and volunteers, led by myself as Director. We are deeply embedded in the community we serve, and our approach is always collaborative and responsive to local needs. Decision-making at Draper Together is democratic and community-driven. Major strategic decisions are made by the Board of Trustees, informed by regular consultation with staff, volunteers, service users, and local partners. We actively seek feedback through surveys, community meetings, and informal conversations, ensuring our services remain relevant and impactful. Our management style is hands-on, flexible, and rooted in a genuine commitment to empowering the community. Ultimately, Draper Together exists to create a welcoming, supportive space where people of all ages and backgrounds can thrive. We believe in the power of local action to transform lives, and every activity we deliver is a step toward a stronger, more resilient community.
properties.title: Draper Hall

properties.address: Restorative Justice For All International Institute, london, London SE16 2LJ
properties.description: The RJ4All Rotherhithe Community Centre is South East London's hub of community empowerment and cohesion. Through the Centre, we aim to implement our Founder's vision of making SE16 London's first restorative post-code. At RJ4All, we believe that in order to achieve community cohesion and reduce anti-social behaviour, first we must adopt a holistic approach that addresses the reasons that lead to divisions. Poverty and power abuse must be rooted out, if we are genuinely interested in supporting and empowering communities to participate and indeed enjoy civic life equally. To this end, all local service providers (public, private and voluntary) must come together and under the guidance of the restorative justice values of power sharing, equality, dignity and respect support local communities. With the above vision in mind and with the support of our landlord, Clarion Futures Communities , Southwark Council and many local stakeholders, we have set up the following services, which are open to anyone: community fridge, education and digital inclusion, social community space, health and community cohesion, youth club+, wellbeing circle cafe, charity shop and safe house.

properties.description: Our church offers a warm welcome to anyone, regardless of ethnic background, faith, age, disability status, gender or sexuality. Come in to be greeted by our friendly volunteers and to get a free hot drink. You can also take part in our activities, get support, pick up emergency food or use our free wifi. Perhaps you'll share a skill, make new friends or just be quiet in our atmospheric but cozy space. We look forward to meeting you!

This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: THURSDAYS Natter with Neighbours is a friendly welcoming FREE drop in session and coffee morning that's been going for two years. Run by Penge East Community Association for friends and neighbours near and far who would like to join us! Accessible & child friendly building & garden. Everyone's very welcome! There are toys, colouring resources and a swing in the garden for young children. Refreshments- including fruit, croissants, real coffee courtesy of Carnival Coffee. Drop in for the whole 2 hours or any part of this. There's a community noticeboard publicising services and volunteering opportunities in Penge. TUESDAYS Wellbeing evenings run 6:30pm-8pm between 21st January 2025 and 25th February 2025. Free fun, self-care activities – everyone’s welcome - no previous experience needed! (6.30pm for refreshments: sessions start at 7pm). Sessions include basic First Aid with St John Ambulance; get creative with Penge Art Club; celebrate health & balance in your body with Qi Gong; share tips for reducing our impact on the planet; learn why Mrs Maple gave Penge a fountain, and find your voice in a community scratch choir evening! (St John will also run sessions on Saturday February 1st). Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: Thursdays Natter with Neighbours runs throughout the year. Tuesdays Wellbeing evenings run 21 Jan 2025 - 25th Feb 2025 Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know:
